ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: You learn a solid foundation of the Spanish language.
This class was outstanding. I am shocked at how much Spanish we all learned within one semester.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I am a big fan of the immersion technique in this course because you learn the language very quickly.
I wonder if interspersing more tests/quizzes more frequently throughout the semester would be more productive than having four large exams in the final two weeks.
The format and efficiency of the class, led by Professor Lourdes, was amazing.

Meeting every day can be tough, especially if you already have a heavy courseload. However, I think it did really help me to learn Spanish much more quickly. In comparison to other language courses I have taken, this course was as (or more) effective and engaging. Learning languages are hard, there's no way around that, so overall I think this course is very well designed.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes because the course in organized and very well suited for students to learn Spanish.
I would. However, I would recommend that they take it P/F or audit it as opposed to taking it for a letter grade if they are taking it during a demanding semester.
Without a doubt, I would highly recommend Professor Lourdes to any prospective students.
